results.title: Something for everyone
results.brief_description: Looks at the problem of youth unemployment and how it affects job seekers. Uses a humorous approach to present the case of a young man who loses his job and the problems he faces when he tries to find another. Cast includes: David Bradley, Lachlin Miles, Dave Taggart, Pina Marino, Rossi Webb, Ingrid Buxton. Music: Milton Trot and Bill Menz.

results.title: Something don't seem right
results.creator_credit: Bill Steller, Robin Hughes and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: One of a series of films which looks at the lives of children growing up in different environments. Shows the world of a child living in the inner city area, attending Newtown High School, and the physical and financial constraints on his family.

results.title: Something creative
results.creator_credit: Gillian Leahy and Crafts Council of Australia
results.brief_description: This film looks at the question of creativity in everyday life and examines the role of the professional artist in stimulating and encouraging participation in the arts by the community at large. Focuses on Orange and Blacktown in New South Wales. Cinematography by Erika Addis.

results.title: Something big in micro circuits
results.creator_credit: Tony Baker, G. Buckland-Smith, Katrina Rank and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: A detailed look at the vast field of the diminuitive. Animated sequences showing the various etching and photographic processes needed to produce transistors and other miniaturised equipment are described in detail.

results.title: Somethin' about Scandanavia: as told by a Danish boy
results.creator_credit: Bent Barfod and Government Film Committee of Denmark
results.brief_description: This animated film gives a lighthearted resume of Norway, Sweden, Denmark and Iceland; their history and geography, main products, standard of living and dependence upon trade and co-operation for prosperity. Based on an idea by Carl T. Dreyer. Animation by Berge Hamberg.

results.title: Somerset Maugham's Quartet
results.creator_credit: Ralph Smart, Harold French, Arthur Crabtree, Ken Annakin, Antony Darnborough, Gainsborough Pictures and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description: Somerset Maugham himself introduces these adaptations of his short stories. “The Facts of Life”: a highly entertaining story about a young man’s trip to Monte Carlo, where he ignores his father’s parting advice, and emerges from the experience better off. “The Alien Corn”: a young man (Dirk Bogarde) is determined to become a concert pianist, despite his parents’ objections. “The Kite”: Herbert’s marriage falls apart because of his obsession with flying kites. “The Colonel’s Lady”: a stuffy retired colonel is baffled by the discovery that his wife has a reputation as a passionate poetess.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ralph Smart, Harold French, Arthur Crabtree, Ken Annakin, Antony Darnborough, Gainsborough Pictures and Rank Film Productions

results.title: Someone to Love
results.creator_credit: Henry Jaglom, M Simonson and International Rainbow Pictures
results.brief_description: Danny (Henry Jaglom) invites his friends to a St. Valentine’s Day party in a disused cinema which is about to be demolished to make way for commercial development. Danny, an unrelenting romantic, in the early stages of a relationship with Helen (Anrea Marcovicci) is investigating why people feel alone. Some of the participants play themselves, others play roles. They are an assortment of Danny’s/Jaglom’s friends - actors, singers, musicians and artists. As he turns the camera on his friends and himself, the film takes an off-beat and hilarious persona akin to Gestaltian LA of the ‘70s. Orson Welles makes his final screen appearance as the omniscient bearer of wisdom.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Henry Jaglom, M Simonson and International Rainbow Pictures

results.title: Someone new (episode 2)
results.brief_description: Shows the growth of a baby and the birth. These events take place within the lives of three families and the birth as shown as happy and relaxed. The birth of kittens and puppies is also shown to further explain what happens when someone new is born.
